lines.text: I am death, come with me.
Come with me. I am death.
What about the bad guys?
What bad guys?
The bad guys that are taking over the neighborhood.
Now where did you hear that?
Go watch TV, Gordie.
That's probably where he heard it.
Stay away from Louis Thibadeau.
How come?
Your witness doesn't have any idea what a cocaine cowboy is. Why didn't you tell him?
Everybody calls you Mr. Thibadeau. Is that because of what you did in the war?
No, Gordie, it's because I'm old. Besides that war was a long time ago, nobody remembers it.
Paddy does.

[about the shooting]
It's all over the front page.
Meg, if a dog has pups it's on page one.

[walking Gordie to band practice]
We're late.
So why don't we drive?
Because you need the exercise.
What for?
So you don't have a heart attack before you're 12.
That's why I gave up smoking and drinking.
I wish you'd talk to Paddy about giving Gordie so many donuts.

[absentmindedly]
Yes Meg.
And Louis, no more war stories.

[absentmindedly]
Yes Meg.
And we're gonna have rattlesnakes for dinner.

[absentmindedly]
Yes Meg.
I thought you were going to quit playing with that tank.
So did Mrs. Whitehead.
Would you like something for the pain?
[Louis grumbles]
What?
Bourbon.
